xxl.core.xml.storage
Class EXTree

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.xml.storage.EXTree

public class EXTree
extends Object

This class allows the efficient storage of an XML-Tree.

updateParentIdsInChildSubtrees

protected static void updateParentIdsInChildSubtrees(Node subtree,
                                                     Object newParentId,
                                                     Container container)
Sets the parentId of all children records of the subtree to the new identifyer.

Parameters:
subtree - The subtree which is searched for proxy nodes.
newParentId - The new identifyer of the parent
container - Container used for storing the tree.

insertAttribute

public boolean insertAttribute(XPathLocation xPath,
                               String name,
                               String value)
Inserts an attribute in the markup with the given xPath.

Parameters:
xPath - the xPath that points to the markup
name - the name of the attribute
value - the value of the attribute
Returns:
true if the attribute has been successfully inserted into the tree, false otherwise

insertLiteralNode

public boolean insertLiteralNode(XPathLocation xPath,
                                 String value)
Inserts a literal. The given String will be treated as a String. If it has a other type, i.e. Byte, Short, Integer, use the other insert method to specify a type. The getObject() method in LiteralNode return an Object according to this tpye. Default is String.

Parameters:
xPath - the xPath that points to the location (to the markup) where the literal has to be inserted.
value - the value of the literal
Returns:
true if the attribute has been successfully inserted into the tree, false otherwise

insertLiteralNode

public boolean insertLiteralNode(XPathLocation xPath,
                                 String value,
                                 int type)
Inserts a literal. The bytes from the given String will be treated as i.e. Byte, Short, Integer, use the type parameter to specify a type, see the class LiteralNode for these types. The getObject() method in LiteralNode return an Object according to this tpye.

Parameters:
xPath - the xPath that points to the location (to the markup) where the literal has to be inserted.
value - the value of the literal
type - an int that indicates the type of the literal
Returns:
true if the attribute has successfully inserted into the tree, false otherwise

insertMarkupNode

public boolean insertMarkupNode(XPathLocation xPath,
                                String tagName)
Inserts a markup-node into the tree.

Parameters:
xPath - the location (the parent-node) where to insert the markup
tagName - the tagName of this markup-node
Returns:
true if the markup-node has been successfully inserted into the tree, false otherwise

removeMarkup

public boolean removeMarkup(XPathLocation xPath)
Removes the Node with the given xPath. That includes removing of the complete subtree of node. Returns true if the remove was succesfull, false otherwise.

Parameters:
xPath - the xPath of the node that should be removed by this method
Returns:
true if the remove was successfull, false otherwise

toXML

public void toXML(PrintStream out,
                  boolean withStructure)
Writes the current XML-Document to the PrintStream (in correct XML syntax).

Parameters:
out - the PrintStream to which the XML-Code will be written.
withStructure - determines if the proxy and scaffold nodes are also written to XML.

public void toXML(OutputStream out,
                  boolean withStructure)
Writes the current XML-Document to the OutputStream (in correct XML syntax).

Parameters:
out - the OutputStream to which the XML-Code will be written.
withStructure - determines if the proxy and scaffold nodes are also written to XML.

getXMLChildren

public Iterator getXMLChildren(Node node)

getStructureOutputPredicate

public static Predicate<Object> getStructureOutputPredicate(PrintStream ps)
Returns a predicate that outputs the structure of the tree in a short form to a PrintStream (to be used in conjunction with treeTraversal).

Parameters:
ps - The PrintStream used for the output.

treeTraversal

public void treeTraversal(Object id,
                          Node root,
                          Predicate predicate)
Traverses the tree beginning at root and calls a predicate with 2-4 parameters. The function is called with two parameter, when a new subtree is entered. The first parameter is the identifyer inside the container, the second parameter is the root of the new subtree which is entered. The function is called with three or four parameters, when a node is detected. The parameters are:
  • The identifyer of the subtree in the container
  • Boolean.TRUE/Boolean.FALSE: is it the start or the end of a tag (literal nodes only one function call with Boolean.TRUE)
  • The current node.
  • For the start tag of proxy nodes only: the subtree to which the proxy points.
If the predicate returns false, then the subtree of the current node is not entered.

Parameters:
root - root of the current subtree.
predicate - Predicate which is called during tree traversal.

treeTraversal

public void treeTraversal(Predicate predicate)
Traverses the whole tree beginning at the root and calls a predicate with 2-4 parameters. The function is called with two parameter, when a new subtree is entered. The first parameter is the identifyer inside the container, the second parameter is the root of the new subtree which is entered. The function is called with three or four parameters, when a node is detected. The parameters are:
  • The identifyer of the subtree in the container
  • Boolean.TRUE/Boolean.FALSE: is it the start or the end of a tag (literal nodes only one function call with Boolean.TRUE)
  • The current node.
  • For the start tag of proxy nodes only: the subtree to which the proxy points.
If the predicate returns false, then the subtree of the current node is not entered.

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate which is called during tree traversal.

query

public Cursor query(XPathLocation xp)
Queries the tree for an XPathLocation.

Parameters:
xp - The XPathLocation which is tried to match.

Object the root identifyer.

id - the new identifyer

getMaxSubtreeSize

Returns:
the maximum subtree size in bytes.

checkTreeQuality

public EXTree.TreeQuality checkTreeQuality()
Checks the quality of the EXTree. To output the result, it is convenient to call the toString method of the result.
